C1E_Support.HELP_STRING: This should be enabled in order to enable or disable the "Enhanced Halt State".

Hardware_Prefetcher.HELP_STRING: For UP platforms, leave it enabled. For DP/MP servers, it may use to tune performance to the specific application.

Adjacent_Cache_Line_Prefetch.HELP_STRING: For UP platforms, leave it enabled. For DP/MP servers, it may use to tune performance to the specific application.

Intel_R__Virtualization_Tech.HELP_STRING: When enabled, a VMM can utilize the additional HW Caps. provided by Intel(R) Virtualization Tech. Note: A full reset is required to change the setting.

Execute_Disable_Bit_Capability.HELP_STRING: When disabled, force the XD feature flag to always return 0.

Intel_R__HT_Technology.HELP_STRING: When 'Disabled' only one thread per enabled core is enabled.

L1_Data_Prefetcher.HELP_STRING: For UP platforms, leave it enabled. For DP/MP servers, it may use to tune performance to the specific application.

Intel_R__SpeedStep_tm__tech.HELP_STRING: Disable: Disable GV3 Enable: Enable GV3

Intel_R__TurboMode_tech.HELP_STRING: Turbo mode allows processor cores to run faster than marked frequency in speific condition

Performance_Watt_select.HELP_STRING: Power Optimized: Turbo Boost engages after P0 state is sustained for more than 2 sec. Traditional: Turbo Boost engages even for P0 state requests less than 2 sec.

Intel_R__C_State_tech.HELP_STRING: CState: CPU idle is set to C2/C3/C4

C_State_package_limit_setting.HELP_STRING: Selected option will progrmae into C State package limit register

C1_Auto_Demotion.HELP_STRING: When enable, CPU will conditionally demote C3/C6/C7 requests to C1 based on uncore auto-demote information.

C3_Auto_Demotion.HELP_STRING: When enable, CPU will conditionally demote C6/C7 requests to C3 based on uncore auto-demote information.

Type.HELP_STRING: Select the type of device connected to the system.

LBA_Large_Mode.HELP_STRING: Disabled: Disables LBA Mode. Auto: Enables LBA Mode if the device supports it and the device is not already formatted with LBA Mode disabled.

Block__Multi_Sector_Transfer__Mode.HELP_STRING: Disabled: The Data transfer from and to the device occurs one sector at a time. Auto: The Data transfer from and to the device occurs multiple sectors at a time if the device supports it.

DMA_Mode.HELP_STRING: Select DMA Mode. Auto : Auto detected SWDMAn: SingleWordDMAn MWDMAn: MultiWordDMAn UDMAn : UltraDMAn

S_M_A_R_T_.HELP_STRING: S.M.A.R.T. stands for Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology.

ARMD_Emulation_Type.HELP_STRING: Select ARMD device emulation type by BIOS.

S_M_A_R_T_.HELP_STRING: S.M.A.R.T. stands for Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology.

ARMD_Emulation_Type.HELP_STRING: Select ARMD device emulation type by BIOS.

Legacy_USB_Support.HELP_STRING: Enables support for legacy USB. AUTO option disables legacy support if no USB devices are connected.

USB_2_0_Controller_Mode.HELP_STRING: Configures the USB 2.0 controller in HiSpeed (480Mbps) or FullSpeed (12Mbps).

BIOS_EHCI_Hand_Off.HELP_STRING: This is a workaround for OSes without EHCI hand-off support. The EHCI ownership change should claim by EHCI driver.

Hotplug_USB_FDD_Support.HELP_STRING: A dummy FDD device is created that will be associated with the hotplugged FDD later. Auto option creates this dummy device only if there is no USB FDD present.

USB_Mass_Storage_Reset_Delay.HELP_STRING: Number of seconds POST waits for the USB mass storage device after start unit command.

___Emulation_Type.HELP_STRING: If Auto, USB devices less than 530MB will be emulated as Floppy and remaining as hard drive. Forced FDD option can be used to force a HDD formatted drive to boot as FDD (Ex. ZIP drive).
If Auto, USB devices less than 530MB will be emulated as Floppy and remaining as hard drive. Forced FDD option can be used to force a HDD formatted drive to boot as FDD (Ex. ZIP drive).
If Auto, USB devices less than 530MB will be emulated as Floppy and remaining as hard drive. Forced FDD option can be used to force a HDD formatted drive to boot as FDD (Ex. ZIP drive).
If Auto, USB devices less than 530MB will be emulated as Floppy and remaining as hard drive. Forced FDD option can be used to force a HDD formatted drive to boot as FDD (Ex. ZIP drive).
If Auto, USB devices less than 530MB will be emulated as Floppy and remaining as hard drive. Forced FDD option can be used to force a HDD formatted drive to boot as FDD (Ex. ZIP drive).
If Auto, USB devices less than 530MB will be emulated as Floppy and remaining as hard drive. Forced FDD option can be used to force a HDD formatted drive to boot as FDD (Ex. ZIP drive).
If Auto, USB devices less than 530MB will be emulated as Floppy and remaining as hard drive. Forced FDD option can be used to force a HDD formatted drive to boot as FDD (Ex. ZIP drive).
If Auto, USB devices less than 530MB will be emulated as Floppy and remaining as hard drive. Forced FDD option can be used to force a HDD formatted drive to boot as FDD (Ex. ZIP drive).
If Auto, USB devices less than 530MB will be emulated as Floppy and remaining as hard drive. Forced FDD option can be used to force a HDD formatted drive to boot as FDD (Ex. ZIP drive).
If Auto, USB devices less than 530MB will be emulated as Floppy and remaining as hard drive. Forced FDD option can be used to force a HDD formatted drive to boot as FDD (Ex. ZIP drive).

Headless_mode.HELP_STRING: Enable / Disable Headless operation mode through ACPI.

WHEA_Support.HELP_STRING: Enable or disable Windows Hardware Error Architecture.

AHCI_BIOS_Support.HELP_STRING: Enables for supporting AHCI controller operates in AHCI mode during BIOS control otherwise operates in IDE mode.

SATA_Port0_.HELP_STRING: Select the type of device connected to the system.

S_M_A_R_T_.HELP_STRING: S.M.A.R.T. stands for Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology.

SATA_Port1_.HELP_STRING: Select the type of device connected to the system.

S_M_A_R_T_.HELP_STRING: S.M.A.R.T. stands for Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology.

SATA_Port2_.HELP_STRING: Select the type of device connected to the system.

S_M_A_R_T_.HELP_STRING: S.M.A.R.T. stands for Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology.

SATA_Port3_.HELP_STRING: Select the type of device connected to the system.

S_M_A_R_T_.HELP_STRING: S.M.A.R.T. stands for Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology.

SATA_Port4_.HELP_STRING: Select the type of device connected to the system.

S_M_A_R_T_.HELP_STRING: S.M.A.R.T. stands for Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology.

SATA_Port5_.HELP_STRING: Select the type of device connected to the system.

S_M_A_R_T_.HELP_STRING: S.M.A.R.T. stands for Self-Monitoring, Analysis and Reporting Technology.

SEL_Entry_Number_.HELP_STRING: Use +/- to traverse the event log.

IP_Assignment.HELP_STRING: On first time into Setup Menu,if BMC Capable of DHCP, then DHCP will be shown as first option.Otherwise Static option will be shown.

Relaxed_Ordering.HELP_STRING: Enables/Disables Pci Express Device Relaxed Ordering.

Maximum_Payload_Size.HELP_STRING: Set Maximum Payload of Pci Express Device or allow System BIOS select the value.

Extended_Tag_Field.HELP_STRING: If ENABLED, allows Device to use 8-bit TAG field as a requester.

No_Snoop.HELP_STRING: Enables/Disables Pci Express Device No Snoop option.

Maximum_Read_Request_Size.HELP_STRING: Set Maximum Read Request Size of Pci Express Device or allow System BIOS select the value.

Active_State_Power_Management.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable PCI Express L0s and L1 link power states.

Extended_Synch.HELP_STRING: If ENABLED, allows generation of Extended Synchronization patterns.

BIOS_ARI_Support.HELP_STRING: Alternative Routing-id Interpretation (ARI) extends the maximum number of functions on a PCI device from 8 to 256.

PCI_Express_Slot__3_Width_.HELP_STRING: Select the number of lanes for PCI Express Slot #3. Selecting x16 will cause Slot #4 to be disabled.

PCI_Express_Slot__5_Width_.HELP_STRING: Select the number of lanes for PCI Express Slot #5. Selecting x16 will cause Slot #6 to be disabled.

Serial_port_number.HELP_STRING: Select Serial Port for console redirection. Make sure the selected port is enabled.

Flow_Control.HELP_STRING: Select Flow Control for console redirection.

Redirection_After_BIOS_POST.HELP_STRING: Disable: Turns off the redirection after POST Boot Loader: Redirection is active during POST and during Boot Loader. Always: Redirection is always active. (Some OSs may not work if set to Always) [Enabled] - keep it [Disabled]- deactivate

VT_UTF8_Combo_Key_Support.HELP_STRING: Enable VT-UTF8 Combination Key Support for ANSI/VT100 terminals.

Sredir_Memory_Display_Delay.HELP_STRING: Gives the delay in seconds to display memory information

TCG_TPM_SUPPORT.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable TPM TCG (TPM 1.1/1.2) support in BIOS

PCI_Latency_Timer.HELP_STRING: Value in units of PCI clocks for PCI device latency timer register.

OffBoard_PCI_IDE_Primary_IRQ.HELP_STRING: DISABLED: Use if this channel on card does not need an IRQ. INTx: Use these settings to assign an IRQ to the IntPin used by this channel. Hardwired: The card hardwires a fixed INTx into IntPin.

OffBoard_PCI_IDE_Secondary.HELP_STRING: DISABLED: Use if this channel on card does not need an IRQ. INTx: Use these settings to assign an IRQ to the IntPin used by this channel. Hardwired: The card hardwires a fixed INTx into IntPin.

NET0_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: This Option enables execution of the onboard network controllers' Optional ROMs for legacy support. The onboard network devices are not bootable with this disabled.

NET1_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: This Option enables execution of the onboard network controllers' Optional ROMs for legacy support. The onboard network devices are not bootable with this disabled.

NET2_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: This Option enables execution of the onboard network controllers' Optional ROMs for legacy support. The onboard network devices are not bootable with this disabled.

NET3_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: This Option enables execution of the onboard network controllers' Optional ROMs for legacy support. The onboard network devices are not bootable with this disabled.

PCI_E_Slot_0_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable loading of the Option ROM for PCI-E Slot 0

PCI_E_Slot_1_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable loading of the Option ROM for PCI-E Slot 1

PCI_E_Slot_2_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable loading of the Option ROM for PCI-E Slot 2

PCI_E_Slot_3_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable loading of the Option ROM for PCI-E Slot 3

PCI_E_Slot_4_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable loading of the Option ROM for PCI-E Slot 4

PCI_E_Slot_5_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable loading of the Option ROM for PCI-E Slot 5

PCI_E_Slot_6_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable loading of the Option ROM for PCI-E Slot 6

PCI_E_Slot_7_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable loading of the Option ROM for PCI-E Slot 7

PCI_E_Slot_8_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable loading of the Option ROM for PCI-E Slot 8

PCI_E_Slot_9_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable loading of the Option ROM for PCI-E Slot 9

Cluster_Card_Slot_Option_ROM_.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable loading of the Option ROM for Cluster Card Slot

PCI_MMIO_64_Bits_Support.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable memory mapped I/O of 64-bit PCI devices to 4GB or greater address space.

I_O_Allocation_for_Slot_0.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable allocation of legacy I/O resources to this slot

I_O_Allocation_for_Slot_1.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable allocation of legacy I/O resources to this slot

I_O_Allocation_for_Slot_2.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable allocation of legacy I/O resources to this slot

I_O_Allocation_for_Slot_3.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable allocation of legacy I/O resources to this slot

I_O_Allocation_for_Slot_4.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable allocation of legacy I/O resources to this slot

I_O_Allocation_for_Slot_5.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable allocation of legacy I/O resources to this slot

I_O_Allocation_for_Slot_6.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable allocation of legacy I/O resources to this slot

I_O_Allocation_for_Slot_7.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable allocation of legacy I/O resources to this slot

I_O_Allocation_for_Slot_8.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable allocation of legacy I/O resources to this slot

I_O_Allocation_for_Slot_9.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable allocation of legacy I/O resources to this slot

I_O_Allocation_for_Cluster__Card_Slot.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable allocation of legacy I/O resources to this slot

Prompt_on_Config_Change.HELP_STRING: Enables prompt to enter setup when Boot Device configuration changes

Quick_Boot.HELP_STRING: Allows BIOS to skip certain tests while booting. This will decrease the time needed to boot the system.

Quiet_Boot.HELP_STRING: Disabled: Displays normal POST messages. Enabled: Displays OEM Logo instead of POST messages.

AddOn_ROM_Display_Mode.HELP_STRING: Set display mode for Option ROM.

Wait_For__F1__If_Error.HELP_STRING: Wait for F1 key to be pressed if error occurs.

Interrupt_19_Capture.HELP_STRING: Enabled: Allows option ROMs to trap interrupt 19

Boots_Graphic_Adapter_Priority.HELP_STRING: Select which graphics controller to use as the primary boot device.

Onboard_VGA_device.HELP_STRING: Enable/Disable onboard VGA chip. Note: Do not disable if you have not installed a VGA card

Persistent_Boot_Mode.HELP_STRING: When enabled, the boot list is comprised only of persistent storage devices. Disabling will revert back to default boot handing from next boot.

_26th_Drive.HELP_STRING: Specifies the boot sequence from the available devices.

_1st_Drive.HELP_STRING: Specifies the boot sequence from the available devices.

_2nd_Drive.HELP_STRING: Specifies the boot sequence from the available devices.

_3rd_Drive.HELP_STRING: Specifies the boot sequence from the available devices.

_4th_Drive.HELP_STRING: Specifies the boot sequence from the available devices.

_1st_Drive.HELP_STRING: Specifies the boot sequence from the available devices.

_2nd_Drive.HELP_STRING: Specifies the boot sequence from the available devices.

_3rd_Drive.HELP_STRING: Specifies the boot sequence from the available devices.

_4th_Drive.HELP_STRING: Specifies the boot sequence from the available devices.

User_Access_Level.HELP_STRING: LIMITED: allows only limited fields to be changed such as Date and Time. NO ACCESS: prevents User access to the Setup Utility. VIEW ONLY: allows access to the Setup Utility but the fields can not be changed. FULL: allows any field to be changed except the Supervisor password.

Password_Check.HELP_STRING: Setup: Check password while invoking setup. Always: Check password while invoking setup as well as on each boot.

MMConfigBase.HELP_STRING: Select the Memory Mapped Config Space base address.

QPI_Debug_Message_Output_Level.HELP_STRING: Controls what levels of debug message output is needed.

QPI_Link_Speed.HELP_STRING: Select the QPI link speed as either the POR speed (Fast) or default speed (Slow).

QPI_Link_Frequency_Select.HELP_STRING: Allows for selecting the QPI Link Frequency.

MMIOL_Reclaim.HELP_STRING: Enable or Disable reclaim of MMIOL from High Memory Helps workaround certain OSes, which don't support greater than 40bit addressing with 1TB of system memory

MRC_Debug_Messages.HELP_STRING: This is to enable MRC debug message through the serial port.

InterleaveType.HELP_STRING: This would select how many memory nodes are included in Interleaving.

Frequency_Limit.HELP_STRING: Forces a DDR3 frequency slower than the common tCK detected via SPD. A DDR3 frequency faster than the common frequency is a config error. Options are AUTO, 800MHz, 978MHz and 1067MHz. AUTO will set the fastest common speed as determined from the SPD information.

Initialization_mode.HELP_STRING: This would select memory Initialization mode, either Serial or Parallel.

Ecc_Patrol_Scrub.HELP_STRING: This would enable Ecc Patrol Scrub.

_Duration.HELP_STRING: This would select duration between two patrol scrubs.

ECC_check_time_interval.HELP_STRING: Time interval between two memory ECC checks. IPMI message will be posted when an ECC error happens.
